alert.note: Alert for Arlington; City of Alexandria; City of Falls Church; Fairfax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 05 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following counties: Arlington, City of Alexandria, City of Falls Church and Fairfax. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arlington... Alexandria... Annandale... Fairfax... Vienna... Falls Church... Mantua... Pimmit Hills... Oakton... Lincolnia... Merrifield... Lake Barcroft... I66 and I495 Interchange... Seven Corners... Dunn Loring... Baileys Crossroads... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Arlington; City of Alexandria; City of Falls Church; Fairfax
